data.description: An introduction to the statistical methods used in public policy. Covers the basics of probability, statistics, and quantitative methods in public policy analysis. Stresses interpretation and presentation of data as well as theory.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO STATISTICAL METHODS FOR PUBLIC POLICY ANALYSIS

data.description: Compares the conceptual, statistical, and ethical issues of experimental, quasi-experimental and non-experimental designs for program evaluation. Definitions of outcomes, sample size issues, statistical biases in measuring causal effects of programs, and the reliability of findings will be emphasized using case studies selected from current public programs.
data.title: PUBLIC PROGRAM EVALUATION
